ActInsurance Companies Act
SubjectRegulations Amending Certain Regulations Made Under the Insurance Companies Act
PrecisRegulations Amending CERTAIN REGULATIONS MADE UNDER THE INSURANCE COMPANIES ACT in order to (1) require a holding company making an application to the Minister of Finance for discontinuance from the Insurance Companies Act and towards continuance under the Canada Business Corporations Act to include in its incorporating instrument, for the duration of the protection period, a provision that restricts the issue, transfer or ownership of its shares to prevent it from having a major shareholder; (2) allow the holding company to amend its incorporating instrument in order to remove the share restrictions in cases where the Minister of Finance is of the opinion that the converted company is, or is about to be, in financial difficulty and that a proposed acquisition would facilitate an improvement in its financial condition; (3) increase the duration of the protection period for demutualized companies from two to four years; and (4) correct a discrepancy between the English and French versions of the regulations.
